The Kashi Vishwanath Temple is one of the most revered Hindu temples to offer prayers to Lord Shiva, the presiding deity of the temple.It is located in Varanasi, a city on the banks of the holy river Ganges. 

 Legend has it that,the city of Kashi was built by Lord Shiva himself in ancient times. Over the centuries, the temple was destroyed and rebuilt several times due to invasions and natural disasters. Finally, in the 18th century, the temple was rebuilt by the Maratha queen, Ahilyabai Holkar, and it has stood strong ever since. 

 It is said that a visit to this sacred temple and taking a dip in the holy waters can wash away all sins and grant the devotee eternal blessings.

 The Kashi Vishwanath Temple also played a crucial role in India's struggle for independence. During the British rule, it was seen as a symbol of Indian culture and was a meeting point for freedom fighters. It was here, Pandit Madan Mohan Malviya gave his clarion call for the Non-Cooperation Movement in 1921.
